com.pb.sawdust.calculator

Class NumericFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.calculator.NumericFunctions

  • public class NumericFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    The NumericFunctions class contains interfaces and methods related to numerical functions.

      • TERNARY

        public static final NumericFunctionN TERNARY
        Get a function which returns its second argument if the first resolves to (numerically) true, or its third argument if the first resolves to (numerically) false. It is equivalent to the Java ternary statement, if applied to a numeric boolean first argument: arg1 ? arg2 : arg3.

    • Method Detail

      • foldLeft

        public static byte foldLeft(NumericFunction2 function,
            byte... values)
        Recursively apply a two-argument numeric function to a series of bytes, starting from the "left". That is, if the function is f(x,y) and the arguments are a1, a2, and a3, in that order, then the result of this method would be f(f(a1,a2),a3).
        Parameters:
        function - The function to apply.
        values - The values the function will be applied to.
        Returns:
        the result of applying function to values recursively.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if values.length < 2.

      • foldRight

        public static byte foldRight(NumericFunction2 function,
             byte... values)
        Recursively apply a two-argument numeric function to a series of bytes, starting from the "right". That is, if the function is f(x,y) and the arguments are a1, a2, and a3, in that order, then the result of this method would be f(a1,f(a2,a3)).
        Parameters:
        function - The function to apply.
        values - The values the function will be applied to.
        Returns:
        the result of applying function to values recursively.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if values.length < 2.

      • foldLeft

        public static short foldLeft(NumericFunction2 function,

        Recursively apply a two-argument numeric function to a series of shorts, starting from the "left". That is, if the function is f(x,y) and the arguments are a1, a2, and a3, in that order, then the result of this method would be f(f(a1,a2),a3).
        Parameters:
        function - The function to apply.
        values - The values the function will be applied to.
        Returns:
        the result of applying function to values recursively.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if values.length < 2.

      • parameter

        public static NumericFunctionN parameter(java.lang.String parameterName)
        Get a NumericFunctionN used to specify parameters in the CompositeNumericFunction constructor.

        Returns:
        a composite numeric function parameter named parameterName.

      • compositeNumericFunction

        public static NumericFunctionN compositeNumericFunction(NumericFunctionN... reversePolishFunctions)
        Get a numeric function built from other numeric functions. The composite function is specified as a combination of NumericFunctionN functions and parameters (indicated by PARAMETER) listed in reverse-polish notation. For example, to specify the function f(x,y,z) = (x+y)*z, the following call would be made (this assumes import static com.pb.sawdust.calculator.NumericFunctions.*): 
             compositeNumericFunction(PARAMETER,PARAMETER,ADD,PARAMETER,MULTIPLY);
        Parameters:
        reversePolishFunctions - The functions and parameters specified in reverse-polish notation.
        Returns:
        the composite function built from reversePolishFunctions.

      • compositeNumericFunction

        public static NumericFunctionN compositeNumericFunction(java.util.List<NumericFunctionN> reversePolishFunctions)
        Get a numeric function built from other numeric functions. The composite function is specified as a combination of NumericFunctionN functions and parameters (indicated by PARAMETER) listed in reverse-polish notation. For example, to specify the function f(x,y,z) = (x+y)*z, the following call would be made (this assumes import static com.pb.sawdust.calculator.NumericFunctions.*): 
             compositeNumericFunction(PARAMETER,PARAMETER,ADD,PARAMETER,MULTIPLY);
        Parameters:
        reversePolishFunctions - The functions and parameters specified in reverse-polish notation.
        Returns:
        the composite function built from reversePolishFunctions.

      • constant

        public static NumericFunction0 constant(double value)
        Get a constant-valued numeric function. This (zero-argument) function can be used in the CompositeNumericFunction constructor to specify constant values.
        Parameters:
        value - The constant value.
        Returns:
        a function which always returns value.

      • constant

        public static NumericFunction0 constant(long value)
        Get a constant-valued numeric function. This (zero-argument) function can be used in the CompositeNumericFunction constructor to specify constant values.
        Parameters:
        value - The constant value.
        Returns:
        a function which always returns value.

      • getPlaceholderFunction

        public static NumericFunction1 getPlaceholderFunction(java.lang.String name)
        Get a placeholder ("do-nothing") function with a given name. This method can be useful when a calculation will involve processes which occur outside of the scope of the numeric function calculations, but whose occurance need to be noted/annotated in some fashion. The returned function will pass through any argument unchanged.
        Parameters:
        name - The name for the function.
        Returns:
        a placeholder function named name.

      • inValues

        public static NumericFunction1 inValues(long... values)
        Get a function which returns 1 if the argument is found in the array of values, 0 if not.
        Parameters:
        values - The values the argument will be checked against.
        Returns:
        a function which indicates if the argument is found in a series of values.

      • withinRange

        public static NumericFunction1 withinRange(long lower,
                           long upper)
        Get a (numeric boolean) function which returns 1 if the argument is on (lower,upper), 0 if not.
        Parameters:
        lower - The (exclusive) lower bound for the range.
        upper - The (exclusive) upper bound for the range.
        Returns:
        a function which indicates that the argument is within the specified range.

        public static NumericFunction1 withinLowerBoundedRange(long lower,
                                       long upper)
        Get a (numeric boolean) function which returns 1 if the argument is on [lower,upper), 0 if not.
        Parameters:
        lower - The (inclusive) lower bound for the range.
        upper - The (exclusive) upper bound for the range.
        Returns:
        a function which indicates that the argument is within the specified range.

      • foldRecurse

        public static NumericFunction1 foldRecurse(NumericFunction2 function2,
                           NumericFunction1 function1)
        Get a function which will will compose a two-argument (f(x,y)) and one-argument (g(x)) function in such a way that it returns f(x,g(x)) for a given argument x.
        Parameters:
        function2 - The two-argument function.
        function1 - The one-argument function.
        Returns:
        the functions which composes function1 as the second argument to function2.

      • booleanPass

        public static NumericFunction1 booleanPass(NumericFunction1 booleanFunction)
        Get a function which returns its argument if the specified (boolean numeric) function evaluates to 1 for the argument, 0 otherwise.
        Parameters:
        booleanFunction - The (boolean numeric) function used to test the argument.
        Returns:
        a function which will pass its argument if that argument passes booleanFunction.

      • compose

        public static NumericFunctionN compose(NumericFunction1 outer,
                       NumericFunctionN inner)
        Get a function which returns the composition of two functions. That is, it returns the result of the outer function applied to the result of the inner functions (outer(inner(parameters ...))).
        Parameters:
        outer - The outer function.
        inner - The inner function.
        Returns:
        a function which composes outer with inner.

      • shortCircuitTernary

        public static NumericFunctionN shortCircuitTernary(NumericFunctionN test,
                                   NumericFunctionN ifTrue,
                                   NumericFunctionN ifFalse)
        Get a function which returns its second argument if the first resolves to (numerically) true, or its third argument if the first resolves to (numerically) false. It is equivalent to the Java ternary statement, if applied to a numeric boolean first argument: arg1 ? arg2 : arg3. This function will only resolve its second (third) argument if the first argument resolves to numerically true (numerically false).
        Parameters:
        test - The function representing the test case for the ternary operator.
        ifTrue - The function to apply if test resolves to (numerically) true;
        ifFalse - The function to apply if test resolves to (numerically) false;
        Returns:
        a ternary function which only resolves its arguments if necessary.

      • filter

        public static NumericFunctionN filter(int variableCount)
        Get a function which returns (numerically) true if all of its arguments are (numerically) true, or (numerically) false if any of them are (numerically) false.
        Parameters:
        variableCount - The number of arguments the function takes.
        Returns:
        1 if all of the arguments are (numerically) true, 0 otherwise.
